unnormalised: New Delhi: Big news coming in from AIIMS! Apparently, Dr. Sharma and his team have achieved a breakthrough in treating Stage 3 lung cancer. They're using a new immunotherapy drug, code named "IM-09," in trials, and initial results look promising. Already, 15 out of 20 patients have shown significant improvement, which is pretty darn good compared to standard chemo!
normalised: New Delhi: Big news coming in from A-I-I-M-S! Apparently, Doctor Sharma and his team have achieved a breakthrough in treating Stage three lung cancer. They're using a new immunotherapy drug, code named "I-M-zero nine," in trials, and initial results look promising. Already, fifteen out of twenty patients have shown significant improvement, which is pretty darn good compared to standard chemo!

unnormalised: The trials are still ongoing, of course. They started back on 01/06/2023, and are expected to run for another 18 months. The side effects seem to be manageable so far – mostly just fatigue and some skin rashes, nothing too crazy.
normalised: The trials are still ongoing, of course. They started back on first June two thousand and twenty three, and are expected to run for another eighteen months. The side effects seem to be manageable so far – mostly just fatigue and some skin rashes, nothing too crazy.

unnormalised: Fingers crossed this IM-09 becomes widely available ASAP! Cancer's a total menace, and any new weapon in the fight is a win for all of us. Let's hope they can get it approved by, say, Q4 2025? That would be amazing. Good on you, Dr. Sharma & the entire AIIMS crew!
normalised: Fingers crossed this I-M-zero nine becomes widely available A-S-A-P! Cancer's a total menace, and any new weapon in the fight is a win for all of us. Let's hope they can get it approved by, say, Q four two thousand and twenty five? That would be amazing. Good on you, Doctor Sharma and the entire A-I-I-M-S crew!
